verses.verse: Now the Philistines<WH6430> gathered<WH6908> together all<WH3605> their armies<WH4264> to Aphek:<WH663> and the Israelites<WH3478> pitched<WH2583> by a fountain<WH5869> which<WH834> is in Jezreel.<WH3157>

And the lords<WH5633> of the Philistines<WH6430> passed<WH5674> on by hundreds,<WH3967> and by thousands:<WH505> but David<WH1732> and his men<WH582> passed<WH5674> on in the rear guard<WH314> with Achish.<WH397>

Then said<WH559> the princes<WH8269> of the Philistines,<WH6430> What<WH4100> do these<WH428> Hebrews<WH5680> here? And Achish<WH397> said<WH559> to the princes<WH8269> of the Philistines,<WH6430> Is not this<WH2088> David,<WH1732> the servant<WH5650> of Saul<WH7586> the king<WH4428> of Israel,<WH3478> which<WH834> has been<WH1961> with me these<WH2088> days,<WH3117> or<WH176> these<WH2088> years,<WH8141> and I have found<WH4672> no<WH3808> fault<WH3972> in him since he fell<WH5307> to me to this<WH2088> day?<WH3117>

And the princes<WH8269> of the Philistines<WH6430> were wroth<WH7107> with him; and the princes<WH8269> of the Philistines<WH6430> said<WH559> to him, Make this fellow<WH376> return,<WH7725> that he may go<WH7725> again<WH7725> to his place<WH4725> which<WH834> you have appointed<WH6485> him, and let him not go<WH3381> down<WH3381> with us to battle,<WH4421> lest<WH3808> in the battle<WH4421> he be an adversary<WH7854> to us: for with which<WH4100> should he reconcile<WH7521> himself to his master?<WH113> should it not be with the heads<WH7218> of these<WH1992> men?<WH582>

Is not this<WH2088> David,<WH1732> of whom<WH834> they sang<WH6030> one to another in dances,<WH4246> saying,<WH559> Saul<WH7586> slew<WH5221> his thousands,<WH505> and David<WH1732> his ten<WH7233> thousands?<WH7233>

Then Achish<WH397> called<WH7121> David,<WH1732> and said<WH559> to him, Surely, as the LORD<WH3068> lives,<WH2416> you have been upright,<WH3477> and your going<WH3318> out and your coming<WH935> in with me in the host<WH4264> is good<WH2896> in my sight:<WH5869> for I have not found<WH4672> evil<WH7451> in you since the day<WH3117> of your coming<WH935> to me to this<WH2088> day:<WH3117> nevertheless the lords<WH5633> favor<WH2896> you not.
Why now<WH6258> return,<WH7725> and go<WH3212> in peace,<WH7965> that you displease<WH6213> not the lords<WH5633> of the Philistines.<WH6430>

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Achish,<WH397> But what<WH4100> have I done?<WH6213> and what<WH4100> have you found<WH4672> in your servant<WH5650> so long<WH3117> as I have been<WH1961> with you to this<WH2088> day,<WH3117> that I may not go<WH935> fight<WH3898> against the enemies<WH341> of my lord<WH113> the king?<WH4428>

And Achish<WH397> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> I know<WH3045> that you are good<WH2896> in my sight,<WH5869> as an angel of God:<WH430> notwithstanding<WH389> the princes<WH8269> of the Philistines<WH6430> have said,<WH559> He shall not go<WH5927> up with us to the battle.<WH4421>

Why now<WH6258> rise<WH7925> up early<WH7925> in the morning<WH1242> with your master's<WH113> servants<WH5650> that are come<WH935> with you: and as soon as you be up early<WH7925> in the morning,<WH1242> and have light,<WH216> depart.<WH3212>

So David<WH1732> and his men<WH582> rose<WH7925> up early<WH7925> to depart<WH3212> in the morning,<WH1242> to return<WH7725> into<WH413> the land<WH776> of the Philistines.<WH6430> And the Philistines<WH6430> went<WH5927> up to Jezreel.<WH3157>
